item.title: Johnny Oro
item.description: Ringo and His Golden Pistol is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Sergio Corbucci and starring Mark Damon.

item.title: Dead Men Don't Make Shadows
item.description: Dead Men Don't Make Shadows, aka Stranger That Kneels Beside the Shadow of a Corpse is a 1970 spaghetti western directed by Demofilo Fidani.

item.title: Bury Them Deep
item.description: Bury Them Deep is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Paolo Moffa and starring Craig Hill.

item.title: Sartana the Gravedigger
item.description: I am Sartana, Your Angel of Death is a 1969 Italian Western film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo and starring Gianni Garko. The film is presented on some DVD reissues under its German title, Sartana - Töten war sein täglich Brot.

item.title: Silver Saddle
item.description: Silver Saddle, is a 1978 Spaghetti Western. It is the third and final western directed by Lucio Fulci and one of the last spaghetti westerns to be produced by a European studio. The film was based on an original story written by screenwriter Adriano Bolzoni and directed by Fulci for the Italian studio Rizzoli Film Productions.

item.title: Chino
item.description: Chino is a 1973 Italian Western film starring Charles Bronson, Jill Ireland, Marcel Bozzuffi, and Vincent Van Patten. The original English language title shown at the beginning of the film was The Valdez Horses, the same title that the novel on which the movie is based. It was an Italian-Spanish-French co-production filmed in Spain, with Italian and French funding.
